intro: Lepturus nesiotes, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, saline conditions of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Lepturus nesiotes plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing nectar for native pollinators.
